result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L. Mcghee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michelle L. Mcghee in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF108, 15CF143, 15CF161, & 15CF188  @ 11:30 am.  State gives plea agreement, amended information filed on 15CF143, Atty Goetz has copy, 15CF108, plea to ct 1, Ct 2 DRI, 15CF143 Plea to ct 1 & ct 2, Ct 3 DRI, 15CF161, plea to ct 1, Dismissed ct 2 & 3. 15CF188 DRI, 15CF108, & 15CF143 withheld sentence 2 years probation and  15CF161 withheld sentence 1 year, AODA and follow through, costs, Credit on 108 6 days credit, 143 2 days credit.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charges and penalties.  15CF108 Ct 1 Poss of Meth, no contest, 15CF143 Ct 1 Bailjumping, no contest plea, Ct 2 Poss of Cntrl Substance, no contest  15CF161 Ct 1 D.C. no contest plea.  15CF108 Ct 2 DRI,  15CF143 Ct 3 DRI  15CF161 Ct 2 & 3 DRI &  15CF188 DRI.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understand elements.  Atty Goetz is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated in all complaints.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty in 15CF108 in Ct 1 Poss of Meth, 15CF143 Bailjumping in ct 1 and Poss of Cntrl Substance in ct 2 and 15CF161 ct 1 D.C. State gives sentencing recommendation.  Atty Goetz gives sentencing recommendation.  Def. makes statement.  Judge address bail/bond forfeiture. Atty Goetz would like bond to be applied to court costs.  Court orders  on 
15CF108 ct 1  withheld sentence 2 years probation, AODA deemed by agent and complete follow through, Any counseling deemed by agent, 250 DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample, Credit for 6 days if revoked, court costs
15CF143 ct 1  withheld sentence 2 years probation, costs, 200 DNA Surcharge, concurrent and any other probation, AODA deemed by agent and complete follow through, Any counseling deemed by agent, Credit for 2 days
ct 2 withheld sentence 2 years probation,  costs, 200 DNA Surcharge, concurrent and any other probation, AODA deemed by agent and complete follow through, Any counseling deemed by agent, Credit for 2 days
15CF161 Ct 1 withheld sentence 1 year probation, costs, 200 DNA Surcharge  concurrent and any other probation, AODA deemed by agent and complete follow through, Any counseling deemed by agent.  Bond applied in 15CF188 to other cases.  15CF108 Bond applied. Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. No victim on D.C. case per State. Court goes over elements on all cases with defendant. Def. will proceed as is.  Sentence will remain.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 4, 2017 at 11:00 am.
State's

Court calls 15CF108, 15CF161, 15CF143 and 15CF188 @ 9:56 a.m.  Defendant Michelle L. Mcghee in court by telephone with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def was ordered to appear in person, explains that car broke down. Court will excuse today. Court orders bonds forfeited, however will hold for now and allow Def to make argument at future court date. Def advises does not wish to accept offer that was made previously. Court will set 15CF108 for trial. Court advises Def she must appear at final pre-trial and will either have jury trial or plea and sentencing on 10/12/16. If plea/sentencing, will be at 1:00 p.m. Discussion regarding discovery and bonds.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
of Preliminary Examination

Defendant Michelle L. Mcghee in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF108,15CF143, 15CF161and  15CF188.  Waiver of preliminary examination filed with court.  Court reviews form with def.  Right to preliminary reviewed with def.    Def waives right to preliminary to all files.  Court accepts waiver.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over.  Informations filed.  Waive reading.  Not guilty pleas entered to all counts.  Reserve jurisdicational objections.  Court will receive not guilty pleas.   Matter set for status conf.  Possible plea and sentence, def to appear for status conf.   Arguments  to lift no contact provision on bond, presented by Atty Goetz.  Response by State.  Def is on probation for Shawano county case.  Court will remove the no contact with R.P. if no objection by probation officer.  Review of bond forfeitures.  Court will continue these matters  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 09:45 am.
to Modify Bond
Bail/bond hearing on June 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michelle L. Mcghee in court with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF161, 15CF188, 15CF143, and 15CF108 @ 1:39 p.m. 15CF108 and 15CF188 set for bail forf. hrgs and all four set for plea/sentencing. Def now does not want to accept offer and wishes to go to trial. Atty Bayne-Allison has advised the Court that he will not be able to continue representing Def due to reasons stated off the record. All to be set for status conference. Regarding bond forfeitures - State gives reasons for forfeiting. 15CF188 - Def failed to appear. 15CF108 - new charges. Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding previous hrg. Statement by Defendant. Court reinstates the bonds, will not be forfeited. Def to appear at status conference.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing

Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CF108, 15CF143, 15CF161 and 15CF188.  Matter was set for plea and sentencing.  Def has called atty's office and clerks office.  Indicated she is sick.  State is requesting bonds be forfeited, pending hearing.  Court will forfeit bonds, pending hearing.  This hearing will also be set for the same date  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF108,15CF143.  Called at 3:22 pm.  Court reviews file.  Notices has been sent.  Def has violated conditions of bond. Court will forfeit bonds.  Def now appears in person.  Recess for counsel to discuse this matter with client.  Back on record.  Court reads statue for bond forfeiture.  State request bonds still be forfeited.  Response by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Bond of $100. be forfeited.  Court will order that the $500.00 cash bond be forfeited.  Court will not forfeited the $100.00 cash bond and will cover 15CF108.  Statement by counsel.  Court will order a $300.00 cash bond to cover all files.  $200.00 cash bond posted previously plus the $100.00 in 15CF108 will cover all files
